revised_title: Kinetic Spectroscopy of Hydrocarbon Explosive Combustion: Free Radical Absorption in Acetylene Combustion
tldr: This study investigates the explosive combustion of hydrocarbons using kinetic spectroscopy, focusing on the absorption spectra of free radicals in acetylene combustion. The authors discovered four stages in the explosive reaction and observed the absorption spectra of OH, CN, and other radicals throughout the process. This research provides valuable insights into the chemical kinetics of combustion and the role of free radicals in the reaction.
